alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Delaware (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 02 at 1:11AM CST until March 04 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Flint Creek near Kansas affecting Cherokee and Delaware Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Flint Creek near Kansas. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flint Creek threatens individual campsites and becomes dangerous for recreational floating. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.7 feet this morning. It will then rise to 8.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
